Description.description: (Optional) The group's description. Only supported on Windows.

PerformAction.description: (Optional) Set this to 'Yes' to perform the action.

runCommand:
#!/bin/bash
set -e

ExitWithFailureMessage() {
    MESSAGE="$1"
    JSON="$2"
    if [[ "$JSON" == "PRINT_JSON" ]]; then
        echo "{\"error\":\"$MESSAGE\"}"
    fi
    WriteStandardError "$MESSAGE"
    exit 1
}

ExitWithSuccessMessage() {
    echo "$1"
    exit 0
}

WriteStandardError() {
    MESSAGE="$1"
    (>&2 echo "$MESSAGE")
}

TestPerformAction() {
    if [[ "$1" != "Yes" ]]; then
        echo "No action was taken because the PerformAction parameter is set to $1. To make the desired change, set this parameter to Yes."
        exit 0
    fi
}

Group='{{ Group }}'

PERFORMACTION='{{ PerformAction }}'
TestPerformAction "$PERFORMACTION"

if grep -q "^$Group:" /etc/group; then
    ExitWithFailureMessage 'The specified group already exists.'
fi

if type -P groupadd &>/dev/null; then
    groupadd "$Group" || ExitWithFailureMessage 'Failed to create the specified group.'
    ExitWithSuccessMessage 'The specified group has been created.'
else
    ExitWithFailureMessage 'The required command groupadd does not exist.' 'PRINT_JSON'
fi
